I begin to find it interesting how call-stacks and application state is now considered magic with await/async/generators and all that. Has everyone forgotten about a state machine with an event loop?

Krondo’s slow poetry with twisted, seems like a slow way to learn something. Possibly the worst way to try and learn twisted in fact. Needs a serious rewrite.

What’s the big deal with generators?

And an interesting library Suspend

Then I wanted to double check something with python generators, and in some reading came across an article (will go unnamed) with various poor examples that actually don’t work. Point is, if you’re going to have a coding blog you should test your code. Accuracy is essential to all journalism.
